verses.roman:
mahāprabhura bhare naukā kare ṭalamala
ḍubite lāgila naukā, jhalake bhare jala

synonyms: mahāprabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; bhare—because of the weight; naukā—the boat; kare—does; ṭalamala—tilting; ḍubite—to sink; lāgila—began; naukā—the boat; jhalake—in gushes; bhare—fills; jala—water.
translation: Due to the Lord's heavy weight, the boat began to tilt. It began filling up with water and was on the verge of sinking.
